diff_analysis.evidence: OLD http3 header parsing used qpack streaming DecodeFunc without a strict total header size limit, only per-field accounting with a fixed overhead (len(name)+len(value)+32). This could allow a peer to send many small headers or trailers that bypass the intended MaxHeaderBytes / SETTINGS_MAX_FIELD_SECTION_SIZE constraint, leading to unbounded memory growth when accumulating headers (CWE-770). The NEW code switches to qpack.Decoder.DecodeFull with explicit uint64 maxHeaderBytes checks on HEADERS frame length, removing the custom sizeLimit logic and the SETTINGS_MAX_FIELD_SECTION_SIZE handling, indicating the old approach was insufficient for enforcing resource limits.
